required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Indocyanine Green Fluorescent Cholangiography and Intraoperative Angiography With Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Indocyanine Green Fluorescent Cholangiography and Intraoperative Angiography With Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy, a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This was a double blinded, randomized, controlled trial involved patients underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy

detailed_description.textblock: A double blinded, randomized, controlled trial involved patients underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy in Ain-Shams University Specialized Hospital in the period from January 2020 till July 2021. Group A (n=60) underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy using the usual white light, Group B (n=58) underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy with ICG florescence cholangiography and intra-operative ICG florescence arteriography.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual identification of the biliary tree
primary_outcome.description: To measure the % of patients in which we can identify visually the extra hepatic biliary system (the CD, CBD, CHD, and any possible anomalies present), during LC.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual identification of the cystic artery
primary_outcome.description: To measure the % of patients in which we can identify visually the cystic artery, during LC.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during and imediatly after the procedure (24 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: To detect of incidence rate of biliary or vascular injury, visually or clinically, resulted from miss identification of the structures.
To compare the operative time in (minutes)
to compare the operative blood loss (in cc)
to compare the blood loss (in cc)) between the two groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients of ICG adverse reactions
secondary_outcome.description: To measure % of patients suffering off reactions related to the use of ICG (by vital data assessment, monitor patients' complaints, etc..)

arm_group.description: Indocyanine Green Fluorescent Cholangiography and Intraoperative Angiography will be done during the Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
conventional white light was used for Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy

intervention.description: Performing the laparoscopic cholecystectomy and identifying the biliary structures under the conventional white light

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adults (from 18 to 75 years old)
- suffering from a gall bladder disease
- with valid indication for laparoscopic cholecystectomy (e.g., calculus gall bladder with cholecystitis)
- accepted to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with history of previous biliary surgery
- Patients with abdominal malignancy
- Patients with advanced chronic liver disease
- pregnant women
